hello world: question : using jaunty (up-to-date), is there a way to drag a window to another desktop? (i.e. I click on window's title bar, drag it to the right, and when it reaches the edge, hop, it goes to the next desktop on the right)
I use a standard ubuntu with gnome.
Doesn't it do that automatically?
nope :(
If you use Compiz, the compizconfig-settings-manager app can edit pretty much all settings.
I prefere not to use it....
You don't have to use any effects.
mmm. will give it a try. which package do I have to install to set compiz behaviour ?
I just told you - compizconfig-settings-manager
thanks.
Btw, offtopic: If you want, you can use Xfce's xfwm on GNOME.
oh yeah. I didn't thought about it.
do you have a link on how to change gnome default WM ?
Just enable "desktop effects" in the Appearance settings, it'll automatically enable Compiz.
don't want compiz in fact.....
Why not?
Compiz has virtual desktops too
yeah.... I know. but broken here, and all those effects, addons, plugins... even if I stop them all, it's heavier.
In gconf-editor, it's /desktop/gnome/session/required_components
thanks. done.... let's give it a try.
But if you change it to xfwm4, you will probably need to create a new file in /usr/share/applications/xfwm4.desktop -- mine is http://sprunge.us/UWZN
oh, thanks.
ah, yeah, that works fine. thank you!
